{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the relevant documents, object permanence is seen in the sensorimotor stage of Jean Piaget's theory of cognitive development. This stage lasts from birth to about two years of age, and it is during this stage that infants develop an understanding that objects continue to exist even when they cannot be seen or heard. Piaget considered the development of object permanence to be one of the most important accomplishments in this stage.", "answer_choice": "A. Sensorimotor"}
